solution_line_template: First calculate the volume of the aquarium by multiplying its length, width and height: {length} ft * {width} ft * {height} ft = <<{length}*{width}*{height}={total_volume}>>{total_volume} cubic ft
Then figure out what proportion of the aquarium is full after the cat knocks it over: {initial_fill_proportion} * {spilled_proportion} = {proportion_after_spill}
Then figure out what proportion of the aquarium is full after Nancy refills it: {refill_multiplier} * {proportion_after_spill} = {final_proportion}

Now multiply the proportion of the aquarium that's full by the aquarium's volume to find out how much water is in it: {total_volume} cubic ft * {final_proportion} = <<{total_volume}*{final_proportion}={water_volume}>>{water_volume} cubic ft
